Package main.java

Class BankAccount

java.lang.Object
main.java.BankAccount
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Accountable>, Accountable
public class BankAccount extends Object implements Accountable
An implementation of the Accountable interface for bank accounts.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BankAccount(String accountName)
    Constructs an account with the provided account name.

      public BankAccount(String accountName)

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Accountable other)
      Compares this account to the other account to determine if this account is smaller than, equal to, or larger than the other account.

      Required to implement the Comparable interface.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Accountable
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Accountable>
      Parameters:
      other - the account to compare
      Returns:
      a positive value (> 0) if this account has a larger balance, 0 if this account has an equivalent balance, or a negative value (< 0) if this account has a smaller balance.

    • deposit

      public double deposit(double amount)
      Deposits the amount into the account, and returns the new account balance.

      PRE: Only deposit if amount >= 0. Otherwise, ignore the deposit and return the current account balance.

      POST: The account balance should be increased by amount.

      Specified by:
      deposit in interface Accountable
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to deposit
      Returns:
      the new balance of the account

    • getAccountName

      public String getAccountName()
      Returns the name of the account.
      Specified by:
      getAccountName in interface Accountable
      Returns:
      the name of the account

    • getAccountNumber

      public int getAccountNumber()
      Returns the unique numeric ID of the account.

      POST: It must be the case that no other account has the same numeric ID as this account.

      Specified by:
      getAccountNumber in interface Accountable
      Returns:
      the numeric ID of the account

    • getBalance

      public double getBalance()
      Returns the current balance of the account.
      Specified by:
      getBalance in interface Accountable
      Returns:
      the account balance

    • getTransactionHistory

      public List<Double> getTransactionHistory()
      Returns a list of the account transaction history.
      Returns:
      the account transaction history

    • maxTransaction

      public double maxTransaction(int numTransactions)
      Returns the largest (absolute) transaction amount from the last number of transactions.
      Parameters:
      numTransactions - the previous number of transactions to compare
      Returns:
      the largest (absolute) transaction amount from the previous number of transactions

    • processTransaction

      public boolean processTransaction(double transaction)
      Applies the provided transaction to the account, where non-negative transaction amounts are deposits and negative amounts are withdrawals.
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction to apply to the account
      Returns:
      true if the transaction is successful

    • processTransactions

      public boolean processTransactions(double[] transactions)
      Applies the provided transactions to the account in order, where non-negative transaction amounts are deposits and negative amounts are withdrawals.

      PRE: It must be possible to apply all of the transactions in order without overdrafting the account. Otherwise, none of the transactions can be applied to the account, and this method returns false.

      Parameters:
      transactions - the transactions to apply to the account
      Returns:
      true if all of the transactions can be applied to the account without overdrafting

    • transfer

      public boolean transfer(double amount, Accountable other)
      Transfers the amount from this account into the other account.

      PRE: Only transfers if withdraw(amount) == true. Otherwise, ignore the transfer and return false.

      POST: This account balance is reduced by the amount transferred, and the other account balance is increased by the amount transferred.

      Specified by:
      transfer in interface Accountable
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to transfer
      other - the account to transfer funds to
      Returns:
      true if the amount was transferred to the other account

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(double amount)
      Withdraws the amount from the account, and returns true if the withdrawal was successful.

      PRE: Only withdraws if amount >= 0. Otherwise, ignore the withdrawal and return false.

      POST: The account balance should be reduced by amount.

      Specified by:
      withdraw in interface Accountable
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to withdraw
      Returns:
      true if the input amount was withdrawn from the account
